page.title: 11TRAFFIC CENSUS IN ANLABY
page.content: A traffic census was taken one day between 8.30 a.m. and 1 p.m. As Anlaby is a suburban village close to Hull, it is not surprising that most of the traffic movement comes as a result of people travelling to and from the city. By far the biggest percentage of vehicles used is the private car (69%) - most often red ones! The next most frequent users of the roads in the village are the cyclists - usually school children. Only 4% of the traffic consisted of lorries. This is not too surprising since, to the north of Anlaby, there is a busy by-pass which most of the heavy lorries use. The heaviest concentration of traffic occurred between 8.30 - 9 a.m. and between 12 - 1 p.m.
